summary: This is an email chain from March 2024 between attorneys discussing evidence related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails discuss arranging meetings to review original notebooks/journals from 2012 and analyze photographs allegedly showing Epstein on a boat in Oak Bluffs, Martha's Vineyard with a young woman, reportedly taken by Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeanne M. Christensen
persons.context: Attorney representing a client in the Epstein case, corresponding about evidence including a 2012 journal and photographs. She is facilitating the review of original notebooks and sharing photographic evidence.

persons.name: Douglas Wigdor
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence, appears to be a colleague or partner at Wigdor LLP involved in the case.

persons.name: Meredith Firetog
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence, appears to be part of the legal team at Wigdor LLP.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as "JE" in the emails. The subject matter concerns photos of him on a boat with a young woman at Oak Bluffs harbor.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Allegedly took the photographs of Jeffrey Epstein with a young woman on the boat, according to the attorney's client.

persons.name: L. Black
persons.context: Mentioned in the email subject line ('photos with JE'), suggesting a potential connection to the photographs being discussed.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Wigdor LLP, copied on the same case-related correspondence.
Both are part of the legal team at Wigdor LLP, copied on the same case-related correspondence.
Christensen is an attorney discussing evidence (photos, journal) related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The email states Maxwell allegedly took photographs of Epstein with a young woman on a boat.
Christensen is an attorney discussing evidence that allegedly involves Maxwell's actions.

events.title: Creation of Evidentiary Journal
events.description: A journal from 2012 is referenced, with more than 20 people having written in it contemporaneously. The legal team possesses it and the contact information of the writers.

events.title: Epstein Photographed on Boat in Martha's Vineyard
events.description: Alleged event where Jeffrey Epstein was on a boat in Oak Bluffs harbor, Martha's Vineyard, with a young blond woman. Ghislaine Maxwell is alleged to have taken the photographs. They reportedly stayed overnight.

events.title: Attorney Correspondence re: Evidence Review
events.description: Email exchange arranging for an in-person meeting to review original notebooks/journals and discuss photographic evidence related to Epstein and Maxwell.

locations: 85 Fifth Avenue, New York, NY 10003 (Wigdor LLP office)
keyFacts: Attorneys possess a 2012 journal with contemporaneous entries from more than 20 people, whose contact information they also have.
Photographic evidence is discussed showing Jeffrey Epstein on a boat in Oak Bluffs, Martha's Vineyard, with a young blond woman.
The attorney's client alleges that Ghislaine Maxwell took these photographs.
The legal team was actively arranging in-person meetings in March 2024 to review original physical evidence (notebooks).
The email chain highlights ongoing legal work and evidence gathering related to the Epstein case years after the main prosecutions.
